did.abstract: Galdos Benito Perez was born on May 10, 1843 and was a Spanish writer and realist novelist. This collection includes a series of 50 letters written by Perez to Manuel Tolosa Latour, a physician and writer. This collection also includes a photograph of the exterior and a pencil sketch of the interior of Perez Galdos's Villa San Quintin at Santander.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Galdos Benito Perez was born on May 10, 1843. Perez published 31 novels, 46 Epidodios Nacionales, 23 plays, and 20 volumes of shorter fiction, journalism, and other writings. Perez loved to travel and was inspired by philosophy, theater, and music. Perez was nominated for the Nobel Prize in Literature five times between 1912-1916 and was elected to the Royal Spanish Academy in 1897. Perez died on January 4, 1920.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes a series of 50 letters written by Perez to Manuel Tolosa Latour (1857-1919), a physician and writer. This collection also includes a photograph of the exterior and a pencil sketch of the interior of Perez Galdos's Villa San Quintin at Santander. The letters were published in Ruth Schmidt, ed. Cartas entre dos amigos del teatro: Manuel Tolosa Latour y Benito Prez Galds (Cabildo Insular de Gran Canaria, 1969).

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
